DataElement.preferredName: Multiple Hematopoietic Cell Graft Infusion Procedure Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not multiple hematopoietic cell products (grafts) were infused.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Multiple Hematopoietic Cell Graft Infusion Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having, relating to, or consisting of more than one individual, element, part, or other component; manifold. (dictionary.com). _Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)._Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: many copies of or many forms:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.

Concepts.definition: Having, relating to, or consisting of more than one individual, element, part, or other component; manifold.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Property.preferredDefinition: A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.

Concepts.definition: Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
